details: “M” is the thirteenth letter of the modern English alphabet. It represents the /m/ sound, as in 'moon'. The letter 'M' is commonly used in words associated with motion, music, and the natural world.

wordsData.definition: the natural satellite of the Earth, visible by reflection of sunlight
wordsData.example: The moon shone brightly in the night sky.

wordsData.definition: a small to medium-sized primate, typically with a long tail
wordsData.example: The monkey swung from tree to tree.

wordsData.definition: a large natural elevation of the earth's surface, typically with a peak
wordsData.example: They hiked up the mountain to see the view.

wordsData.definition: a tropical stone fruit with sweet, juicy flesh
wordsData.example: She ate a juicy mango on a hot day.

rhymes.name: M is for Moon (to the tune of 'Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star')
content: M is for moon, so big and bright,
Shining down through the quiet night.
Up in the sky so high and wide,
M is for moon, a glowing guide!

rhymes.name: M is for Monkey (to the tune of 'If You’re Happy and You Know It')
content: Monkey swings from tree to tree,
In the jungle all the day!
